articles.author: Erin Banco, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The U.S. decision to allow Ukraine to fire American weapons deeper into Russia has not increased the risk of a nuclear attack, which is unlikely, despite Russian President Vladimir Putin's increasingly bellicose statements, five sources familiar with U.S. intelligence told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nuclear attack unlikely despite Putin's warnings, US intelligence says

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: With the bodies of its fighters still strewn on the battlefield, Hezbollah must bury its dead and provide succour to its supporters who bore the brunt of Israel's offensive, as the first steps on a long and costly road to recovery, four senior officials said.
articles.title: Still counting its dead, Hezbollah faces long road to recover from war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Biden administration is pushing ahead with a $680 million arms sales package to Israel, a U.S. official familiar with the plan said on Wednesday, even as a U.S.-brokered ceasefire in Lebanon between Israel and Hezbollah has come into effect.
articles.title: Biden administration planning $680 million arms sale to Israel - source

articles.author: David Brunnstrom
articles.description: Russia's deputy U.N. ambassador said on Wednesday any decision by President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration to cut support for Ukraine would be a "death sentence" for the Ukrainian army, while accusing Kyiv of trying to drag NATO countries into direct conflict with Russia in the meantime.
articles.title: Russia says Trump Ukraine aid cut would be 'death sentence' for Kyiv's military

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel will gradually withdraw its forces over 60 days as Lebanon's army takes control of territory near its border with Israel to ensure that Hezbollah does not rebuild its infrastructure there.
articles.title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire, brokered by US and France, aims for permanent peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cuban President Miguel Diaz-Canel said on Wednesday the election of U.S. President Donald Trump meant more of the same for Cuba and said his communist-run government does not fear its northern neighbor.
articles.title: Cuban leader Diaz-Canel plays down impact of Trump's election victory

articles.author: Emilie Madi, Haider Kadhim, Ahmad Fahmy
articles.description: The cars began lining up at daybreak, snaking their way slowly through narrow lanes lined with collapsed buildings. A truce had finally ended hostilities between Israel and Hezbollah, and residents of Beirut's suburbs were itching to go home.
articles.title: Amid mass destruction, displaced Lebanese rush home after ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The governments of the United States, Britain, Canada, Norway, and Switzerland on Wednesday jointly condemned the escalating violence against civilians in Mozambique, a southern African nation currently embroiled in weeks of post-election protests.
articles.title: US, Britain and others condemn escalating violence in Mozambique

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syrian rebels in the last opposition enclave in northern Syria launched on Wednesday a wide-scale military operation against the Syrian army and seized territory in the first such advance in years, army and rebel sources said.
articles.title: Syrian rebels launch attack against army in Aleppo province

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A committee in Brazil's lower chamber of Congress approved a bill on Wednesday that would ban abortion in Brazil in all cases including those currently allowed such as fetal deformation, rape or when the mother's health is in danger.
articles.title: Brazilian congressional committee votes for bill to ban abortion
